title: 10+ self-emptying robot vacuums on sale ahead of Amazons spring sale
description: Spring cleaning deals on robot vacuums are here thanks to Amazon's Big Spring Sale. It starts on March 25, but Roborock, Shark, and Eufy deals are already live.
excerpt: Bring home automatic dustbin emptying AND automatic mopping pad washing.
text: Bring home automatic dustbin emptying AND automatic mopping pad washing. All products featured here are independently selected by our editors and writers. If you buy something through links on our site, Mashable may earn an affiliate commission. Automated vacuuming likely means more frequent vacuuming, and more frequent vacuuming means faster dustbin filling. And at this point, that shouldn't be your problem.Automatic dustbin emptying has become such a mainstream robot vacuum feature that a ton of self-emptying robot vacs are solidly in the sub-$500 range â€”Â and even more models join that club when there's a big sale event. The latest one happens to line up perfectly with spring cleaning season: Amazon's second Big Spring Sale is happening between March 25 and March 31. And Amazon is extremely well-versed in robot vacuum deals. With multiple new record-low prices already popping up in the week before the sale starts, your budget could wind up covering even more convenience-related features than you originally expected â€” further minimizing the amount of time you spend doing maintenance-related tasks for the vacuum. If you're set on a robot vacuum that mops, many self-empty docks in the list below also have water tanks and fans for self-washing and drying of the mopping pads after each use.I'm tracking the best deals on self-emptying robot vacuum deals ahead of Amazon's sale below. Why we like itWhen my favorite robot vacuum from 2024 drops to a new record-low price, of course that's the deal I'm going to recommend. But the deal looks even better when put in context with a 2025 Roborock that I'm testing right now. Compared to the 2025 Saros 10R, which goes for $1,599.99, you'd be getting a premium Roborock from 2024 with almost all of the same features for half the price. Mashable Deals The Qrevo Master obviously empties its own dustbin, but it extends that automated maintenance to automatic mopping pad washing and drying (plus automatic water tank refills) in that same dock. In my experience, this self-sustaining mopping pad situation makes me way more likely to actually use the robot mop â€” because otherwise, I end up forgoing a mopping cycle all together because I don't feel like washing the dirty pad by hand all the time. The Qrevo Master also brings home premium features like flexible corner and edge mopping, automatic mop lifting when carpet is sensed, and a livestream pet camera. html:
Bring home automatic dustbin emptying AND automatic mopping pad washing.

All products featured here are independently selected by our editors and writers. If you buy something through links on our site, Mashable may earn an affiliate commission.

Credit: Ian Moore / Mashable Composite; Roborock

A peek at the best early Amazon spring sale deals on self-emptying robot vacuums

Best self-emptying deal with self-washing and drying mopping padsa

Roborock Qrevo Master

$1,299.99 at Amazon (save $600)

Unless you're really trying to save space on the floor, there's little reason to not opt for a self-emptying robot vacuum these days. Automated vacuuming likely means more frequent vacuuming, and more frequent vacuuming means faster dustbin filling. And at this point, that shouldn't be your problem.

Automatic dustbin emptying has become such a mainstream robot vacuum feature that a ton of self-emptying robot vacs are solidly in the sub-$500 range â€”Â and even more models join that club when there's a big sale event. The latest one happens to line up perfectly with spring cleaning season: Amazon's second Big Spring Sale is happening between March 25 and March 31. And Amazon is extremely well-versed in robot vacuum deals.

With multiple new record-low prices already popping up in the week before the sale starts, your budget could wind up covering even more convenience-related features than you originally expected â€” further minimizing the amount of time you spend doing maintenance-related tasks for the vacuum. If you're set on a robot vacuum that mops, many self-empty docks in the list below also have water tanks and fans for self-washing and drying of the mopping pads after each use.

I'm tracking the best deals on self-emptying robot vacuum deals ahead of Amazon's sale below. Note: Deals with a ðŸ”¥ next to them have dropped to record-low prices.

Why we like it

When my favorite robot vacuum from 2024 drops to a new record-low price, of course that's the deal I'm going to recommend. But the deal looks even better when put in context with a 2025 Roborock that I'm testing right now. Compared to the 2025 Saros 10R, which goes for $1,599.99, you'd be getting a premium Roborock from 2024 with almost all of the same features for half the price.

Mashable Deals

The Qrevo Master obviously empties its own dustbin, but it extends that automated maintenance to automatic mopping pad washing and drying (plus automatic water tank refills) in that same dock. In my experience, this self-sustaining mopping pad situation makes me way more likely to actually use the robot mop â€” because otherwise, I end up forgoing a mopping cycle all together because I don't feel like washing the dirty pad by hand all the time.

The Qrevo Master also brings home premium features like flexible corner and edge mopping, automatic mop lifting when carpet is sensed, and a livestream pet camera. Its 10,000 Pa of suction power isn't as juicy as the 20,000 Pa on the pricey Saros 10R, but it's still more powerful than most other vacuums in this list.

More self-emptying robot vacuums on sale

Robot vacuums that mop

  • Dreame D10 Plus Gen 2â€”Â $289.99 $399.99 (save $110) ðŸ”¥

  • Eufy Omni C20 with mop washing station â€” $399.99 $699.99 (save $300)

  • Narwal Freo with mop washing station â€” $499.99 $899.99 (save $400 with on-page coupon) ðŸ”¥

  • Shark RV2820YE PowerDetect 2-in-1 with mop washing station â€” $499.99 $899.99 (save $400) ðŸ”¥

  • Roborock Qrevo S â€” $549.99 $799.99 (save $250)

  • iRobot Roomba Combo 10 Max with mop washing station â€”Â $939 $1,399 (save $400)

  • Roborock Qrevo Curv with mop washing station â€” $1,299.99 $1,599.99 (save $300)

Robot vacuums that don't mop

  • Eufy L50 â€”Â $239 $299 (save $60 with on-page coupon)

  • Shark AI Ultra AV2511AE â€”Â $299.99 $599.99 (save $300)

  • Eufy L60 â€”Â $299.99 $449.99 (save $150)

  • iRobot Roomba j9+ â€” $499 $899 (save $300) ðŸ”¥

Leah Stodart is a Philadelphia-based Senior Shopping Reporter at Mashable where she covers essential home tech like vacuums and TVs as well as sustainable swaps and travel. Her ever-growing experience in these categories comes in clutch when making recommendations on how to spend your money during shopping holidays like Black Friday, which Leah has been covering for Mashable since 2017.

The robot vacuum beat in particular has cemented itself as Leah's main ~thing~ across the past few years. Since 2019, her expertise has been perpetually bolstered by the meticulous eye she keeps on robot vacuum deals and new releases, but more importantly, her hands-on experience with more than 25 robot vacuums tested in her own home. (This number has probably gone up by the time you're reading this.) That at-home testing is standardized through Mashable's robot testing guide â€” a granular scoring rubric for assessing all aspects of owning and using a robot vacuum on the daily â€” that Leah created herself.

Leah graduated from Penn State University in 2016 with dual degrees in Sociology and Media Studies. When she's not writing about shopping (or shopping online for herself), she's almost definitely watching a horror movie, "RuPaul's Drag Race," or "The Office." You can follow her on X at @notleah or email her at [emailÂ protected].
